We model a yield estimation for white asparagus (_Asparagus officinalis_ L.) in 2020 and under future climate conditions in 2075 for a location near Cologne in NRW, Germany. 

![](asparagus/Figures/conceptual.png)

**Simplified structure for an asparagus growth model over one high-production year of cultivation with the influence of weather indices. **

# Asparagus yield estimation

Simulation of the yield for 2020 and 2075 under different SSP scenarios

```{r load data, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
# Source our model
library(decisionSupport)
source("asparagus/R/asparagus_sim_scen.R")
source("asparagus/R/youtputs_to_xinputs_scenarios.R")
# Ensure consistent results with the random number generator
# not for each 'run' of the MC simulation but for 
# consistency each time we run the entire simulation 
set.seed(1847)
# read in our input parameter for asparagus
input<-read.csv("asparagus/data/asparagus_input.csv", colClasses = c("character", "character", "character", "character", "numeric", "character","numeric"), sep = ",", dec = ".")
# read in our input parameter for weather indices
risk_df<-read.csv("weathergenerator/risk_df.csv")
# read in our input that identify the different weather scenarios
scenarios<-read.csv("asparagus/data/scenarios.csv")
```

```{r mcsimulation, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE, class.source = 'fold-show'}
# run the simulation
sim_scenarios<-mcSimulation(estimate = as.estimate(input),
                      model_function = asparagus_sim_scen,
                      numberOfModelRuns = 10000,
                      functionSyntax = "plainNames",
                      risk_df,
                      scenarios) 
```

```{r prepare outputs, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
# The weather indices which are calculated in separate functions 
# are part of the output of the model, the youtputs_to_xinputs_scenarios function
# copies them from the $y$ output side to the $x$ input side of the output lists
#so they can be used in the analysis of the model outputs

outputs<-c("water_stress_risk",
           "insect_risk",
           "disease_risk",
           "photosynthetic_active_days",
           "weather_damage_risk",
           "growth_start_doy",
           "speargrowth",
           "chill_portions",
           "late_frost_risk",
           "temp_fluctuation_risk",
           "extreme_rainfall_risk",
           "extreme_heat_risk",
           "Tsoil_mean")

sim_scenarios_output<-youtputs_to_xinputs_scenarios(sim_scenarios, outputs)

```

The Simulation estimates a total yield and a marketable yield, with deduction for quality losses. A realistic outcome is 60-80% around 6 t/ha marketable yield. The documented marketable asparagus in the year 2020 for the area of Cologne was 5.63 t/ha.

```{r plot_dist_public, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
plot_distributions(mcSimulation_object = sim_scenarios_output, 
                                    vars =c("marketable_yield_today", "marketable_yield_ssp1", "marketable_yield_ssp2", "marketable_yield_ssp3", "marketable_yield_ssp5"),
                   old_names = c("marketable_yield_today", "marketable_yield_ssp1", "marketable_yield_ssp2", "marketable_yield_ssp3", "marketable_yield_ssp5"),
                   new_names = c("marketable yield\n2020", "marketable yield\n2075 SSP1 scenario", "marketable yield\n2075 SSP2 scenario", "marketable yield\n2075 SSP3 scenario", "marketable yield\n2075 SSP5 scenario"),
                                    method = 'smooth_simple_overlay', 
                                    base_size = 10, 
                                    x_axis_name = "Compare of marketable yield outcomes")
```
